div.p: No.2243, p. 1238, unit 67, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

Melbourne 30 June 1884
Document is a circular sent to heads of 15 branches of the Chief Secretary's Office.

With reference to the return
See T. Wilson to M, 6 June 1884 (in this edition as 84-06-06a). required by Section 20 of the Public Service Act 1883 I beg now to state that since returning the proofs for correction on the 6th instant I have been furnished with more definite instructions as to the wishes of the Public Service Board in the matter, and accordingly return the proof for further correction.

It is desired that the return should contain the names of all who were in the Service on the 14th February last, including all who were actually employed on that date and excluding any who have been appointed subsequently and the description of duties is to be a description of the duties performed at that time by the officer concerned.

In the column headed "No of years in service" the length of service is to be expressed in years and completed twelfth parts of a year; thus a service of six years three months & twenty nine days will appear as 6 3/12 years.
In case the proof just returned can conveniently be further corrected in these details I enclose a second copy of the proof.

I beg to request that the final proof may be returned to this office without delay.
Copy is not signed, but would have been sent by the Under Secretary.
